page.description: The B directive sets the border style for a radio button when it uses an image for the actual button. When you have multiple directives in a Format string, you separate them with semi-colons ";".

argument.name: X
argument.description: Character. The border style of the button. The default is the normal button style.

case.description: "F" = Gets a 3D border when the mouse is over it.
"T" = Has a colored border when the mouse is over it.

section.note: This directive does not apply to standard radio buttons with text labels or free-form radio buttons.
